alert.note: Alert for Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; New River Mesa; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Valley (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 7:18PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa County through 800 PM MST... At 717 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bumble Bee to near Castle Hot Springs to 7 miles northeast of Wittmann. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Glendale, Scottsdale, Peoria, Surprise, El Mirage, Youngtown, New River, Sun City West, Waddell, Circle City, Sun City, Wittmann, Cave Creek, Carefree, Deer Valley Airport, Downtown Peoria, Surprise Stadium, Arrowhead Mall and Desert Mountain. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 210 and 241. US Highway 60 between mile markers 121 and 154. AZ Route 101 between mile markers 5 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; New River Mesa; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Valley
